Paulo Carreira, who had been out injured for nearly a year, entered the game as a second half substitution and felt great about his thirty minutes game-action.

“It certainly felt great to be back on the pitch,” offered the likable Kitchee attacker.

“I came on as a sub and despite playing in a position (right wing-back) that I have never trained on, it just felt great! As long as I am able to step on the pitch, it really does not matter to me where I play. The AFC Champions League is coming up soon and I hope I can get more playing time, so that I can sharpen up my own form and get ready for the Champions League group stage.”

In September 2013, the Royal Spanish Football Federation made an official request to FIFA for permission to call up Costa for the Spain national team. He had been granted Spanish nationality in July. FIFA regulations currently permit players with more than one nationality to represent a second country if, like Costa, he had only represented his first country in friendly matches.
